intro: Hieracium thesioides, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. It has hairy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium thesioides is often found in open meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
